intro: Limonium hipponense, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and North Africa. It is characterized by its spiky, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has silver-gray foliage and is often found growing in sandy or saline soils. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance. Limonium hipponense is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in challenging coastal environments.
